bugs.title: CVE-2024-0134 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: specially-crafted container image can lead to the creation of unauthorized files on the host [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-0134 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: specially-crafted container image can lead to the creation of unauthorized files on the host [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-0134 nvidia-container-toolkit: specially-crafted container image can lead to the creation of unauthorized files on the host

long_desc.thetext: NVIDIA Container Toolkit and NVIDIA GPU Operator for Linux contain a UNIX vulnerability where a specially crafted container image can lead to the creation of unauthorized files on the host. The name and location of the files cannot be controlled by an attacker. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to data tampering.

Isn't this supposed to be CVE-2024-0132 and CVE-2024-0133, not CVE-2024-0134?

References:
https://nvidia.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/5582
https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvidia-container-toolkit/releases/tag/v1.16.2

(In reply to Debarshi Ray from comment #2)
> Isn't this supposed to be CVE-2024-0132 and CVE-2024-0133, not CVE-2024-0134?

Never mind.  I see that CVE-2024-0134 is a thing:
https://nvidia.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/5585
https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvidia-container-toolkit/releases/tag/v1.17.0
https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7jm9-xpwx-v999

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2323971

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f (golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit-1.17.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f

FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f has been pushed to the Fedora 41 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-0135 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-0135 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-0135 nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit

long_desc.thetext: NVIDIA Container Toolkit contains an improper isolation vulnerability where a specially crafted container image could lead to modification of a host binary. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.
RHEL AI 1.3.2 has nvidia-container-toolkit-1.17.3-1.x86_64, hence RHEL AI 1.3 is already fixed.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2342481

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f (golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit-1.17.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f

long_desc.thetext: NVIDIA Container Toolkit contains an improper isolation vulnerability where a specially crafted container image could lead to untrusted code running in the hostâ€™s network namespace. This vulnerability is present only when the NVIDIA Container Toolkit is configured in a nondefault way. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to denial of service and escalation of privileges.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

bugs.title: CVE-2024-0136 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-0136 golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-0136 nvidia-container-toolkit: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization in NVIDIA Container Toolkit

long_desc.thetext: NVIDIA Container Toolkit contains an improper isolation vulnerability where a specially crafted container image could lead to untrusted code obtaining read and write access to host devices. This vulnerability is present only when the NVIDIA Container Toolkit is configured in a nondefault way. A successful exploit of this vulnerability may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, and data tampering.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2342478

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f (golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit-1.17.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2025-a15b07073f
